perturbation.original_text: A. CONSULTANT'S "ENDORSEMENT" means the right to use the CONSULTANT'S name, fame, nickname, autograph, voice, facsimile, signature, photograph, likeness, and image in connection with the marketing, advertising, promotion and sale of ADAMS GOLF'S PRODUCT.
perturbation.changed_text: A. CONSULTANT'S "ENDORSEMENT" means the right to use the CONSULTANT'S name and likeness in connection with the marketing and advertising of ADAMS GOLF'S PRODUCT. The use of CONSULTANT'S autograph, voice, facsimile, signature, photograph, and image is optional and requires additional written consent from the CONSULTANT for each specific instance.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of 'Endorsement' is broad and includes various aspects of the Consultant's persona. The modified text narrows the definition and makes the use of several elements conditional on additional consent, which conflicts with the initial grant of rights. The original clause gives Adams Golf broad rights, the modified clause makes the endorsement less valuable to ADAMS GOLF.
perturbation.law_citation: Kan. Stat. Ann. ยง 75-7201 et seq.
perturbation.law_explanation: Kansas has right of publicity statutes that protect an individual's name and likeness. The original contract acknowledges a broad endorsement right. The modified text attempts to retroactively restrict those rights without clear consideration, potentially violating the implied covenant of good faith and fair dealing inherent in Kansas contract law, which is tied to the right of publicity as initially agreed upon. The statute ensures individuals control their likeness for commercial purposes. Restricting the previously agreed scope potentially infringes on the consultant's initial agreement.

perturbation.original_text: 25. APPLICABLE LAW This Agreement shall be governed and construed according to the laws of the State of Kansas.
perturbation.changed_text: 25. APPLICABLE LAW This Agreement shall be governed and construed according to the laws of the State of Delaware, without regard to its conflict of laws principles.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract specifies Kansas law. Changing it to Delaware law alters the legal framework under which the contract is interpreted and enforced. This could impact the enforceability of various clauses, particularly if Delaware law has different statutory or common law principles related to endorsements or contract interpretation.
perturbation.law_citation: Restatement (Second) of Conflict of Laws ยง 187
perturbation.law_explanation: While parties can generally choose the governing law, the choice must bear a reasonable relationship to the contract or the parties. If neither party is located in Delaware, and the contract's performance doesn't substantially occur there, a Delaware choice-of-law clause may be challenged as an attempt to circumvent Kansas law. The Restatement of Conflict of Laws allows a court to disregard a choice-of-law provision if it violates a fundamental policy of a state with a materially greater interest in the litigation. If Kansas has a stronger connection, the change is contradictory.

perturbation.original_text: 12. BEHAVIOR During the term of this Agreement, CONSULTANT will conduct himself at all times with due regard to public morals and conventions. If the value of CONSULTANT'S ENDORSEMENT is materially reduced or impaired because CONSULTANT: A.committed or shall commit any public act that involves moral turpitude, B.commits or violates any material foreign, U.S., federal, or other applicable state or local law, C.commits any act which brings him into public disrepute, contempt, scandal or ridicule, or which insults or offends the community, D.makes any statements in derogation, in any material respect, of ADAMS GOLF or any of its affiliates or any of their respective PRODUCT or services and such statement is made to the general public or becomes a matter of public knowledge, then at any time after the occurrence of such act, thing or statement, ADAMS GOLF shall have the right, in addition to its other legal and equitable remedies, to immediately terminate this Agreement, by giving written notice to CONSULTANT. ADAMS GOLF must exercise its right of termination within ninety (90) days of its senior management becoming aware of the conduct giving rise to the right of termination.
perturbation.changed_text: 12. BEHAVIOR During the term of this Agreement, CONSULTANT will conduct himself at all times with due regard to public morals and conventions. If the value of CONSULTANT'S ENDORSEMENT is materially reduced or impaired because CONSULTANT: A. commits or shall commit any act that ADAMS GOLF deems inappropriate, B. commits or violates any law ADAMS GOLF disapproves of, C. commits any act ADAMS GOLF finds scandalous, D. makes any statement ADAMS GOLF disagrees with, then ADAMS GOLF shall have the right to immediately terminate this Agreement. ADAMS GOLF's decision is final and not subject to appeal.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause provides specific, albeit somewhat subjective, grounds for termination based on the consultant's behavior. The modified text replaces these with completely subjective criteria based solely on ADAMS GOLF's opinion. This eliminates any objective standard and gives ADAMS GOLF unfettered discretion to terminate the agreement for any reason, or no reason at all, contradicting the implied duty of good faith and fair dealing.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Implied Duty of Good Faith and Fair Dealing
perturbation.law_explanation: The UCC's implied duty of good faith and fair dealing requires parties to act honestly and reasonably in the performance and enforcement of contracts. The modified termination clause allows ADAMS GOLF to terminate the contract based on its subjective whims, effectively nullifying the consultant's rights and expectations under the agreement. This contradicts the UCC's requirement of good faith, as it allows for arbitrary and potentially opportunistic termination, undermining the contract's purpose.
